I just recently became interested in adult only movies.  I don't like to see a lot of girl/girl scenes so for me this movie was just what I was wanting.  It was nice to finally find a movie that has a lot more man/woman sex scenes than woman/woman sex scenes. I have a feeling that my husband and I are going to watch this over and over again.  I would highly recommend it!

VOSF was actually better than I expected. It isn't in the same league as Surrender's a-list titles from the mid to late 90's, but it can still respectfully wear the softcore badge. The plot is a rip of "A Connecticut Yankee". It starts out in modern times on a video shoot for a rock star. But the director, Gabriella Hall, gets knocked on the head and wakes up in Sherwood Forest in the days of Robin Hood. The sheriff of Nottingham is gone, but his evil, horny, large breasted sister has shown up to cause problems. It's all very tongue in cheek and sufficient to justify several sex scenes.

There are eight sex scenes. Seven are boy/girl and one is girl/girl. There are also a couple of "forest strip club" scenes (don't ask). There are four women and they are all attractive and the sex scenes are all decent. But like I said above, this is a far cry from what Surrender and Cybil Richards (the director) gave us a few years earlier in titles like Femalien and Virtual Encounters.

I want to make it clear that I am reviewing the most recent Shadow DVD release. This disk definitely does contain the unrated version, and not some hacked up R rated version.

If you're a big fan of one or more of the main actresses (Gabriella Hall, Amber Newman, or Shannan Leigh) I'd recommend this.
Lots of dead air. Acting is way old school and not the best kind.

The acting is OK (actually pretty solid for this type of production), the production values are OK, the women are OK. The nudity and sex are disappointing. Soft-core of this era had really started pushing the boundaries and Surrender Cinema was the studio that led the way. I don't know if this is an edited version or what (it indicates otherwise, but you never really know), but this isn't a big deal. Sex scenes are somewhat boring and limited, nudity doesn't get beyond full frontal and not even a whole lot of that.

Surrender spoiled us with "Femalien" all those years ago. "Virgins of Sherwood Forest" (which by the way, there are no virgins here) isn't sexy enough to keep your attention, either in terms of exposure or of hot women, and certainly isn't interesting enough in plot to do so. I had been hoping for more from this grand old soft-core studio.
I got this for my buddy from college.  He says it was a bit tame and rote.  I haven't seen it.

I did enjoy watching this movie, although I believe that this was one of the lesser quality movies of Surrender Cinema. Sci Fi movies are interesting, although this one was not one of my favorites. Considering the price, this purchase was okay
It is an OK premise and some of the scenes are good, but most of them are kind of hokey and the acting in this one is pretty bad.
I bought this DVD because of the beautiful girls.  Anyone who likes beautiful girls will not be disappointed.  The bad plot and bad acting are irrelevant.
Nothing like a B movie that has it's "perky" extras. Soft as soft can be. it does have a storyline sort of.

There were only two scenes in this movie I cared for. The first guy Shannan Leigh does, and the second guy Shannan Leigh does. For a softcore flick it's not too bad. If you're a Shannan Leigh fan this is a must-own. The two scenes she did alone were definitely worth the purchase. Two of the best scenes softcore has to offer in my book.
